title: How do plants take up carbon, hydrogen, and oxygen? - Quora

response.answer_text: Plants take up carbon in the form of carbon dioxide (CO2) from atmosphere in the presence of light at the time of photosynthesis. Plants take up hydrogen and oxygen from soil in the form of water. They also take up oxygen in the form of O2 from the environment in the absence of light at the time of respiration.

They are absorbed by the plants in the form of minerals (inorganic compounds, dissolved in the water, ions).Hydrogen is split from water molecules with the help of light energy during the light reaction of photosynthesis (water photolysis), and gaseous oxygen is produced.
Plants take up hydrogen primarily from water absorbed through their roots, and carbon and oxygen from carbon dioxide that diffuses through their stomata.
